activities: Our organization may collect human resource data and informed consents containing personal information (i.e., patient's full name)
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom

personaldata: Organization, client and patient data.  May include manually process data
recoursemech: Compliance director, two (2) hotlines, a compliance e-mail address, a robust standard operating procedure and a code of conduct policy in the employee handbook. Any questions or concerns regarding the use or disclosure of personal information should be directed to the Evidera Corporate Office at the address given above. Evidera will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding use and disclosure of personal information in accordance with the principles contained in this Policy. For complaints that cannot be resolved between Evidera and the complaintant, Evidera has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panels established by the European data protection authorities and the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner of Switzerland to resolve disputes pursuant to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles.
